question: An inventor claims that a thermal engine, operating between ocean layers at $27^\circ\text{C}$ and $10^\circ\text{C}$, produces 10 kW of power while discharging 9900 kJ/min. This engine is:
In a reversible adiabatic process, the entropy of the system:

A heat engine receives heat from a source at $1000^\circ\text{C}$ and rejects the waste heat to a sink at $50^\circ\text{C}$. If heat is supplied to this engine at a rate of 100 kJ/s, the maximum power this heat engine can produce is:
Which of the following devices operates on the reversed Carnot cycle?

A geothermal power plant of Aboitiz Power harnesses energy from ground water at $150^\circ\text{C}$ and rejects the cold water to $45^\circ\text{C}$. The groundwater is pumped at 450,000 kg/hr. Determine the maximum power capacity of this plant?
The unit of entropy in SI system is:
A geothermal power plant extracts hot water at 17,500 GPM at 350 F and rejects the cold water to river reservoir at 26 F. Determine the maximum power capacity of this plant?
The efficiency of a Carnot engine depends on:

options.c: The temperature of source and sink
options.d: The pressure of source and sink

question: A refrigerator is removing heat from a cold medium at $3^\circ\text{C}$ at a rate of 7200 kJ/h and rejecting the waste heat to a medium at $30^\circ\text{C}$. If the coefficient of performance of the refrigerator is 2, the power consumed by the refrigerator is:
In an open system, mass and energy can:
An ideal gas initially at 300 K and occupying a volume of 20 L is adiabatically compressed. If its final temperature is 400 K and $\gamma = 1.30$, what is its final volume?
The Bataan nuclear fission power plant has an actual efficiency of 39%. If 0.25 MW of power are produced by the nuclear fission, how much electric power does the power plant output?

A Carnot engine operating between a reservoir of liquid mercury at its melting point (233 K) and a colder reservoir extracts 10.0 J of heat from the mercury and does 8.0 J of work during each cycle. What is the temperature of the colder reservoir?

An inverter-type Carnot air conditioner operates between an indoor temperature of $20^\circ\text{C}$ and an outdoor temperature of $39^\circ\text{C}$. How much energy does it need to remove 2000 J of heat from the interior of the house?
A $1/4$ in steel wire is $12 \text{ ft}$ long and is stretched $1/2 \text{ in}$ under a given load. If the modulus of elasticity is $30,000,000 \text{ psi}$, what is the applied load?
Determine the inertia of a rectangle $5 \text{ cm}$ wide at the base and $8 \text{ cm}$ tall, when it is rotated along the base? (REE Sept 2023)
What is the inertia of a $50 \text{ kg}$ solid sphere of diameter $0.8 \text{ meters}$?
Titanium has a modulus of elasticity of $300 \text{ GPa}$ and modulus of shear of $120 \text{ GPa}$. What is the Poisson’s ratio of titanium?

A bar of wrought iron $2 \text{ in}$ square is raised to a temperature of $100^\circ\text{F}$ above its normal. If held so that it cannot expand, what force may oppose it to prevent expansion? Note: $E = 30 \times 10^6 \text{ psi}$ and thermal expansion coefficient of $6.8 \times 10^{-6} / ^\circ\text{F}$.
